title: Domino’s Pizza rebuffed by former Greene King chief
text:
The former boss of pub giant Greene King turned down a plea from Domino’s Pizza investors to take over as its chairman, landing a blow for the takeaway chain in its attempt to calm down warring franchisees.

Domino’s shareholders from both sides of the Atlantic asked Rooney Anand to take over as chairman.

But it is understood that Mr Anand, who stepped down as Greene King chief after 14 years at the helm earlier this year, spurned the approach from the board amid concerns about the recruitment process.

Domino’s is on the hunt for both a new chief executive and chairman. After a bumper 2017, during which it opened scores of new stores, the company has been forced to downgrade annual opening targets....
